security: The document does not appear to contain information that would be harmful to national security. It summarizes an interview and mentions testimony related to Lee Harvey Oswald and his activities with the Fair Play for Cuba Committee.
summary: This document summarizes an interview with Phillip Geraci regarding Lee Harvey Oswald's activities at Carlos Bringuier's store and Geraci's recollection of Oswald's interaction with Bringuier, along with Geraci's limited association with David Ferrie.
summary_one_paragraph: On April 14, 1978, William Brown of the HSCA interviewed Phillip Geraci about his recollections of Lee Harvey Oswald's activities related to the Fair Play for Cuba Committee. Geraci, interviewed in Houston, Texas, reiterated his Warren Commission testimony, noting that Vance Blalock mentioned Oswald inquired if Carlos Bringuier was connected to the Cosa Nostra. Geraci also stated that he was a Civil Air Patrol (CAP) cadet for a year and had minimal contact with David Ferrie. He identified Oswald in a photo book provided by the Committee.
title: Interview Summary: Phillip Geraci on Lee Harvey Oswald and the Fair Play for Cuba Committee
